New Records: Josh Hart finished with a triple-double: 23 points, 15 rebounds, and 10 assists, becoming one of the most triple-doubles in Knicks history.
Key Match Events: Josh Hart led a 17-3 run in the second half, extending the Knicks' lead to seven points.
The Knicks maintained a double-digit lead for the final eight minutes and opened up a 21-point lead at 120-99 on Karl-Anthony Towns' dunk with 4:21 left.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks extended their winning streak to eight games, their longest since a nine-game run earlier in the year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was tight in the first half, with neither team leading by more than seven points.
The Knicks' victory marked a significant milestone in their season.
